definition: the whole truth is revealed (idiom); everything becomes clear
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: We must carry on with the investigation until all the facts are found.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续查讯，直至真相大白。

sentences.english: The mystery of a stolen champion racehorse statue is solved.
sentences.chinese: 一匹冠军马雕塑被偷之谜已经真相大白。

sentences.english: It soon became clear that my father, deep in his reading, had forgotten to put salt in the soup.
sentences.chinese: 很快真相大白，原来是爸爸埋头于读书而忘了加盐。

sentences.english: This is ridiculous and I have no doubt that it will be clarified soon.
sentences.chinese: 这事很荒谬可笑，我相信不久一定会真相大白。

sentences.english: There is, once again, conflict between the Orcs and Humans and the Humans don't come out on top.
sentences.chinese: 人族和兽族间曾经有冲突，人族最终并未真相大白。

sentences.english: The optimist says it was beautiful, until the very last day.
sentences.chinese: 乐观主义说一切都很美好，直到真相大白的那天。

sentences.english: How many airplane and car crashes will occur before they are exposed for what they are?
sentences.chinese: 还会有多少飞机和汽车将在真相大白之前失事？

sentences.english: The truth, Chris decisively shot donne.
sentences.chinese: 真相大白，克里斯果断地向多恩开了枪。

sentences.english: The detective soon ravelled out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 那名侦探很快就于真相大白。

definition: as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
culprit
the truth about sth/the actual facts
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
lit. paper can't wrap fire; fig. the truth will out
to be executed
murderer/assassin
to expose/to uncover
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
to be released from prison
to commit suicide to escape punishment
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
